txt.en: 'You will not succeed in stopping the ritual, brittle one.'
Seek out Dáru Lagúrz
TBD
Defeat Broglok, overseer of Dáru Lagúrz
Talk to Thurindol outside Gorthad Nûr
Shalgoth fled into the deep-barrows of Gorthad Nûr.\n\nYou should confront Shalgoth and stop the ritual.
Thurindol can be found at Echad Uial in Rath Dúath.\n\nYou should talk to Thurindol.
Defeated kergrim ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Follow the path to Gorthad Nûr
The Broken Houses

'The kergrim must congregate somewhere in the Morgul Vale. But where?\n\n'Hmmm... what if they gather at the old Gondorian burial houses that our scouts spotted when we entered the valley? I shiver at the thought of those beasts feeding on the dead, but there are likely to be many good men laid to rest in those old crypts, and the kergrim will not respect their sanctity as we would! You should head towards the charnel houses and defeat any kergrim you find on the way. I will join you when I can.'
The Kergrim of the Morgul Vale have taken control of the old burial houses Gondor had once constructed for Minas Ithil.
Broglok can be found in Dáru Lagúrz.\n\nYou should defeat Broglok.
Shalgoth fled to Gorthad Nûr.\n\nYou should follow Shalgoth.
Kergrim can be found in Rath Dúath.\n\nYou should defeat kergrim in Rath Dúath and seek out Dáru Lagúrz.
The broken houses of Dáru Lagúrz have been taken by the kergrim
TBD
Thurindol can be found outside Gorthad Nûr.\n\nYou should talk to Thurindol.
Talk to Thurindol
Complete: Gorthad Nûr, the Deep-barrow Instance
Defeat kergrim ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

As Broglok falls, his leader watches from the path to the north
'Stay low, my friend. I saw that fiend you chased. Shalgoth entered the tomb ahead.'
These barrows are much older than those of Dáru Lagúrz
